activities:
1. Personal data from research subjects are collected globally (including EU) and are transferred to the United States for clinical analysis/research purposes (pharmaceutical and medical device research), or vice versa.
2. Personal data from research personnel (healthcare professionals) are collected globally (including EU) and are transferred to the United States for clinical research purposes (pharmaceutical and medical device research), or vice versa.
3. Personal data is collected from employees in the framework of research activities.
4. Personal data is collected from employees in the context of the employment relationship.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: offline (research subject/participant data, healthcare professionals data); on-line (research subject data); manually processed data (research subject data); human resources data (employees, healthcare professionals data).
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
